list.name: Jessica's Friend
list.about: In the episode 'Rixty Minutes' of Rick and Morty, Jessica's Friend is shown to have a collection of redheads. This is a reference to the fact that Jessica's Friend has a fetish for redheads in the real world. The creators of the show, Justin Roiland and Dan Harmon, incorporated this detail as an inside joke for the character's voice actress, Kari Wahlgren, who also happens to have a fondness for redheads in real life. It's these kind of subtle references and personal touches that make Rick and Morty such a delight for fans.

list.name: Jim
list.about: Jim, a character from Rick and Morty, is based on Jim Davis, the creator of the popular comic strip 'Garfield'. In the episode 'Meeseeks and Destroy', Jim is shown as an alien who runs a small shop called 'Jim's Minding'. This is a clever nod to Jim Davis and his iconic character Garfield, who is known for his love of lasagna. The creators of Rick and Morty often include pop culture references like this, adding another layer of depth and humor to the show.

list.name: Johnny Depp
list.about: The character named Johnny Depp in Rick and Morty is not actually voiced by the real Johnny Depp. Instead, the character is voiced by a voice actor named Maurice LaMarche, who is known for his ability to imitate various celebrity voices. LaMarche does an excellent job of capturing the essence of Johnny Depp's voice and mannerisms, adding a hilarious twist to the character. This kind of voice acting versatility is one of the many reasons why Rick and Morty is praised for its exceptional voice cast.

list.name: Jon
list.about: The character Jon in Rick and Morty is a parody of Jon Arbuckle, the owner of Garfield in the comic strip 'Garfield'. Jon in Rick and Morty is depicted as a depressed and lonely man who longs for a meaningful connection with his pets. This is a satirical take on Jon Arbuckle's character, who is often portrayed as a bit clueless and socially awkward in the original comic strip. The creators of Rick and Morty enjoy poking fun at popular culture, and this is just one example of their clever parodies.

list.name: Joseph Eli Lipkip
list.about: Joseph Eli Lipkip, also known as Mr. Lipkip, is a character from Rick and Morty who works as a math teacher at Harry Herpson High School. His name is a play on the term 'josephus problem', which is a mathematical problem related to a counting-out game. The josephus problem involves a circle of people where every kth person is eliminated until only one remains. This clever wordplay in Joseph Eli Lipkip's name is just another example of the show's attention to detail and its incorporation of scientific and mathematical concepts.

list.name: Joyce Smith
list.about: Joyce Smith, also known as Mrs. Smith, is the mother of Jerry Smith and the mother-in-law of Beth Smith in Rick and Morty. In the episode 'Mortynight Run', it is revealed that Joyce Smith is an alternate version of Beth Smith from a different reality. This twist adds a layer of complexity to the character and explores the concept of infinite parallel universes in the Rick and Morty multiverse. The show often delves into mind-bending concepts like this, keeping the audience engaged and intrigued.

list.name: Juggling Rick
list.about: Juggling Rick is a version of Rick Sanchez from an alternate reality who is skilled in the art of juggling. In the episode 'Close Rick-counters of the Rick Kind', Juggling Rick is briefly seen juggling three glowing green balls while performing various acrobatic tricks. This is a nod to the immense intellect and dexterity of the Rick character, showcasing his abilities beyond just scientific genius. It's these small details that make each version of Rick in the show unique and fascinating.

list.name: Karen Entity
list.about: Karen Entity is a character from Rick and Morty who is a sentient hive mind made up of multiple robotic bodies. The name 'Karen' is often used colloquially to refer to an entitled and demanding person, particularly in customer service interactions. The choice of the name 'Karen' for this character is a playful nod to this popular cultural reference. It adds a touch of humor and familiarity to the character, highlighting the show's ability to incorporate current trends and memes into its storytelling.

list.name: Katarina
list.about: Katarina is a character from Rick and Morty who appears in the episode 'A Rickle in Time'. She is a temporal entity capable of perceiving and manipulating time. Katarina's character design and abilities are inspired by the concept of a 'fourth-dimensional being', which is often depicted as a being that can perceive time in a non-linear way. The inclusion of characters like Katarina showcases the show's exploration of complex scientific concepts and its ability to push the boundaries of traditional storytelling.

list.name: Keara
list.about: Keara is a character from Rick and Morty who appears in the episode 'The Rickshank Rickdemption'. She is a member of the Galactic Federation and works as an intern for the Rick division. Keara's character design and mannerisms are based on the portrayal of interns in popular culture, often depicted as ambitious and eager to please. This satirical take on interns adds a humorous element to the character and provides commentary on workplace dynamics. Rick and Morty often uses such satirical elements to explore various aspects of society.

list.name: Kevin
list.about: Kevin is a character from Rick and Morty who appears in the episode 'The Ricks Must Be Crazy'. He is an alien scientist and the creator of the Microverse Battery. Kevin's character is a parody of the typical 'cool guy' archetype often seen in popular culture. He is portrayed as arrogant and self-absorbed, constantly seeking validation for his accomplishments. This parody adds a comedic element to the show and serves as a commentary on ego and the pursuit of fame and recognition.

list.name: King Flippy Nips
list.about: King Flippy Nips is a character from Rick and Morty who appears in the episode 'Anatomy Park'. He is the microscopic amusement park's namesake and mascot, and is depicted as a cartoonish king wearing a crown and cape. The name 'Flippy Nips' is a humorous play on words, combining a childlike nickname ('Flippy') with a slightly crude reference ('Nips'). This juxtaposition of child-friendly and adult humor is characteristic of Rick and Morty's style, appealing to a wide range of audiences with its clever wordplay and subversive humor.

list.name: King Jellybean
list.about: King Jellybean is a character from Rick and Morty who appears in the episode 'Meeseeks and Destroy'. He is a royal jellybean ruler of a fantasy kingdom in a magical world. While initially presented as a friendly and charismatic character, it is later revealed that King Jellybean is actually a sexual predator. This twist serves as a commentary on appearances and the dangers of blindly trusting charismatic individuals. Rick and Morty often incorporates dark and thought-provoking themes into its storytelling, challenging traditional expectations of animated shows.

list.name: Kozbian
list.about: Kozbian is a character from Rick and Morty who appears in the episode 'Mortynight Run'. He is a humanoid alien with an appearance similar to that of a koala. The name 'Kozbian' is a clever wordplay combining the words 'koala' and 'lesbian'. This choice of name adds an element of humor and unpredictability to the character, showcasing the show's ability to infuse unexpected jokes and references into its world. Rick and Morty is known for its irreverent and boundary-pushing humor, constantly keeping its audience on their toes.

list.name: Kristen Stewart
list.about: Kristen Stewart is a character from Rick and Morty who appears in the episode 'The ABC's of Beth'. She is an anthropomorphic version of the actress Kristen Stewart, known for her roles in films like 'Twilight' and 'Snow White and the Huntsman'. Kristen Stewart's character in the show is depicted as a warrior princess with a robotic arm, embodying strength and independence. This parody of Kristen Stewart's public image adds a comedic twist to the character and showcases Rick and Morty's ability to play with audience expectations.

list.name: Krombopulos Michael
list.about: Krombopulos Michael is a character from Rick and Morty who appears in the episode 'Mortynight Run'. He is a highly skilled and notorious assassin known for his catchphrase 'I'm very discreet. I have no code of ethics; I will kill anyone, anywhere. Children, animals, old people, doesn't matter. I just love killing.' Krombopulos Michael's character is a satirical take on the archetype of the remorseless and morally bankrupt hitman. His exaggerated personality and over-the-top dialogue provide a darkly comedic element to the show.

list.name: Kyle
list.about: Kyle is a character from Rick and Morty who appears in the episode 'Meeseeks and Destroy'. He is an alien creature with a distinctive appearance, resembling a mix of a reptile and a bird. Despite his non-human appearance, Kyle is shown to have emotions and desires similar to those of humans. This exploration of sentience and empathy in non-human characters is a recurring theme in Rick and Morty, challenging the audience's perception of what it means to be alive and self-aware.

list.name: Lady Katana
list.about: Lady Katana is a character from Rick and Morty who appears in the episode 'Get Schwifty'. She is a Japanese warrior with a katana, reminiscent of traditional samurai warriors. Lady Katana's character design is a blend of historical Japanese aesthetics and futuristic elements, reflecting the show's tendency to mix different styles and genres. This fusion of cultural references adds depth to the character and highlights Rick and Morty's ability to create a rich and diverse universe.

list.name: Larva Alien
list.about: The Larva Alien is a character from Rick and Morty who appears in the episode 'Mortynight Run'. It is a small alien creature with a larva-like appearance and a high-pitched voice. The Larva Alien's character serves as a comedic foil and provides comic relief in tense situations. Its innocent and childlike demeanor contrasts with the darker and more complex themes explored in the show, creating a balance between lightheartedness and depth.

list.name: Lil' Bits
list.about: Lil' Bits is a fictional food product featured in an advertisement within the Rick and Morty universe. It is a snack food that is 'tiny food for tiny people' and is marketed with the slogan 'Put 'em in your mouth, you little s**t!'. This exaggerated and provocative advertising is a parody of real-world food commercials that often employ aggressive marketing techniques. Lil' Bits showcases the show's ability to satirize consumer culture and its willingness to push boundaries in its humor.
